RLO: Apply statistical machine learning concepts to concrete problems.
SLO: Have knowledge of the different paradigms for performing machine learning and appreciate when different approaches will be more or less appropriate.

RLO: Define methods for solving classification, clustering, regression, and other statistical machine learning problems.
SLO: Understand the definition of a range of neural network models, including graph neural networks.

RLO: Solve practical classification, clustering, and regression problems by using and combining several statistical machine learning approaches.
SLO: Derive and implement optimization algorithms for these models.

RLO: Write coherently, concisely, and clearly in a range of formats and for a variety of audiences.
SLO: Understand the foundations of the Bayesian approach to machine learning.

RLO: Explain the societal, legal, and ethical implications of statistical machine learning and optimization.
SLO: Construct Bayesian models for data and apply computational techniques to draw inferences from them.

RLO: Design new algorithms in statistical machine learning.
SLO: Have an understanding of how to choose a model to describe a particular type of data.
Know how to evaluate a learned model in practice.
Understand the mathematics necessary for constructing novel machine learning solutions.
Design and implement various machine learning algorithms in a range of real-world applications.
